tip.translation[0].definitions[0].defini: the end of something, especially something pointed
tip.translation[0].definitions[0].exampl: lights on the wing tips of aeroplanes
He kissed the tip of her nose.
the southern tip of South America
tip.translation[0].definitions[1].defini: a small amount of additional money that you give to someone such as a waiter or a taxi driver
tip.translation[0].definitions[1].exampl: I gave the guy a big tip.
tip.translation[0].definitions[2].exampl: Perhaps she could give us a few tips.
handy tips for decorating a small flat
This week's magazine has some tips on healthy eating.
tip.translation[0].definitions[3].defini: an area where unwanted waste is taken and left
tip.translation[0].definitions[3].exampl: I’ll take this lot to the tip.
tip.translation[0].definitions[4].defini: an extremely dirty or untidy place
tip.translation[0].definitions[4].exampl: The house was an absolute tip.
tip.translation[0].definitions[5].defini: special information about which horse will win a race
tip.translation[0].definitions[6].defini: a secret warning or piece of information, especially to police about illegal activities
tip.translation[0].definitions[6].exampl: Acting on a tip, the police were able to find and arrest Upton.
tip.translation[0].note_box[0].heading: – Meaning 2: a small amount of additional money that you give to someone such as a waiter or a taxi driver
tip.translation[0].note_box[0].sections[: Aren’t you going to leave a tip?
Kim gave the driver a tip.
The service was great and we left a large tip.
A 15% tip is customary in restaurants.
He gave the waitress a $10 tip.
tip.translation[0].note_box[1].heading: – Meaning 3: a helpful piece of advice
tip.translation[0].note_box[1].sections[: He gave me some tips on how to improve my game.
The writer passes on many tips that she has learned over the years.
To keep your bike in good condition, follow these simple tips.
If you listen to the show, you’ll pick up some really useful gardening tips.
Go to their website to find useful tips on buying and selling a home.
He has some simple tips for saving money when you're at the supermarket.
Most recipes come with added cooking tips.
Marie was always willing to share her gardening tips.
The article contains some useful beauty tips.
Ensure the safety of your family with a few simple safety tips from the Fire Service.
tip.translation[1].definitions[0].defini: to move into a sloping position, so that one end or side is higher than the other, or to make something do this
tip.translation[1].definitions[0].exampl: His helmet had tipped forward and the boy pushed it back.
Eric fell asleep, his head gently tipping to one side.
‘So what?’ asked Brian, tipping his chair back on its rear legs.
tip.translation[1].definitions[1].defini: to pour something from one place or container into another
tip.translation[1].definitions[1].exampl: Tip the onions and oil into a large ovenproof dish.
Ben tipped the contents of the drawer onto the table.
Shall I tip the water out?
tip.translation[1].definitions[2].defini: to give an additional amount of money to someone such as a waiter or taxi driver
tip.translation[1].definitions[3].defini: if someone or something is tipped to do something, people think that they are most likely to succeed in doing it
tip.translation[1].definitions[3].exampl: He had been widely tipped to get the new post of deputy director.
the man tipped to become the next president
He’s tipped as a future world champion.
tip.translation[1].definitions[3].note_b: Tip is usually passive in this meaning
tip.translation[2].definitions[0].defini: a piece of advice about what is likely to happen, for example about which shares are likely to go up or down in value
tip.translation[2].definitions[0].exampl: Many clients boast about their broker or their man in the City who gives them tips.
tip.translation[2].definitions[1].defini: a small amount of additional money that you give to someone such as a waiter in order to thank them for their services
tip.translation[2].definitions[1].exampl: She gave the taxi driver a £5 tip.
tip.translation[3].definitions[0].defini: to say who you think is most likely to do something or be successful
tip.translation[3].definitions[0].exampl: He’s tipped to replace the chief executive.
Journalists are tipping her for rapid promotion.
tip.translation[3].definitions[1].defini: to give advice about something, for example about which shares are likely to go up or down in value
tip.translation[3].definitions[1].exampl: These shares were tipped in the Investor’s Chronicle.
Technology-company profits, expected to rise by 29% at the start of the quarter, are now tipped to rise by only 10%.
tip.translation[3].definitions[2].defini: to give a small amount of additional money to someone such as a waiter in order to thank them for their services
tip.translation[3].definitions[2].exampl: According to the waiters, she always tips generously.
